On Sep 24, 2004, at 10:40 AM, Harald Mueller wrote:

> Hi -
> for trying out what coverage means (first, for me ... then maybe for 
> us?)
> with unit testing (with various tools, among others my [not yet public]
> addition of "hansel categories" of Hansel), I would like to have 
> around 5
> not-too-small (say >= 50 classes, >= a few 100 methods) open source 
> with
> "good" unit tests.

Abbot (http://abbot.sf.net) has 200+ classes with ~130 test classes.  
Coverage is occasionally checked with Clover, currently at around 70% 
(http://abbot.sourceforge.net/doc/reports/clover/pkgs-summary.html).  
The coverage tracking is automated, but only periodically updated on 
the website.  Some coverage is particularly sparse around UI code that 
was written before the UI test framework was complete (abbot is used to 
test used to test itself).

Coverage is likely to mean very different things in different projects, 
so looking at a few different projects would best serve to help you 
understand how much it can differ, rather to find a common meaning.  I 
believe it's most useful as a relative measure within the same project 
or in very similar contexts.
